title: Essential spooky Blu-rays are 20% off at Gruv for Halloween
description: In the house of Polygon, Halloween lasts all of October. html:
Oct 17, 2024, 8:54 PM UTC

Image Compilation: Alice Jovanée/Polygon | Image Sources: Various

Alice Jovanée (she/her) is a commerce writer, and she has been writing about gaming and tech since 2005. Prior to Polygon, she worked at publications such as The Verge.

In the house of Polygon, Halloween lasts all of October. We’ve been summoning the spirits of the spooky season with our countdown of horror flicks you must watch, and if you’d like to expand your personal collection of essential films on disc, first-time shoppers at Gruv can currently save 20% on an array of 4K Blu-rays. Just use the code SIGNUP20 at checkout to knock save on your purchase. While this discount is unfortunately limited to a single item per account, there’s nothing stopping you from checking out with a different email if you’d like to pick up more than one.

There are several dozen excellent movies that are eligible for the discount at Gruv, but we’ve hand-picked a few of our favorites for you to check out below.

$23

HBO’s adaptation of The Last Of Us manages to remain loyal to the source material while still finding room to inject its own original story beats into Naughty Dog’s post-apocalyptic narrative.

$25

You can tell a lot about someone by asking which of the Edgar Wright Cornetto trilogy films is their favorite (it’s Shaun of the Dead for me). This six-disc collection includes 4K versions of Shaun of the Dead, Hot Fuzz, and The World’s End, in addition to their respective bonus features.

$17

Beetlejuice is one of Michael Keaton’s best performances as a character whose name starts with the letter B. The classic Tim Burton film is a fantastic showcase of surreal art, crass humor, and mainstream Calypso music.

$10

Jordan Peele’s directorial debut has become a hallmark of modern horror with its suspenseful and unnerving commentary.

$14

Set amongst the Antarctic wilderness, John Carpenter’s The Thing is a suspenseful masterpiece of body horror and creature design that showcases Kurt Russell wearing one of the most outrageous hats we’ve ever seen.

$15

Stanley Kubrick’s The Shining is a slow burn but has earned its place as a horror classic thanks to unforgettable performances by Jack Nicholson and Shelley Duvall.

$11

One of the best zombie films of the last decade, Train to Busan takes the typical tension of the undead onslaught and raises the stakes by placing it in the cramped interior of a high-speed train.

$15

Chronicling one of the most terrifying engineering disasters of the modern age, HBO’s series Chernobyl details the events and aftermath of the nuclear meltdown that occurred on April 26, 1986.

$12

2021’s version of Candyman, written with the help of horror master Jordan Peele, offers a terrifying modern take on the original film.

$14

Perhaps the most famous work from director Guillermo del Toro, Pan’s Labyrinth is a grim fairytale inhabited with memorable creature designs and some excellent body acting on the part of Doug Jones.

$17

The possession of a girl forces the intervention of two priests, who begin to doubt their faith as a result of their conflict with this demonic entity.

$11

A mysterious illness overtaking a small South Korean village prompts an investigation by a local police officer to save his daughter.

Shopkeeper

Polygon’s handpicked deals on games, movies, books, and more.
